KB_shortcut_simple_2_desc.message: Login to KeePass / Select matched login / Show matched logins list
KB_shortcut_simple_2_desc.description: Description of keyboard shortcut setting for the primary action - exact behaviour depends on state when executed

conn_client_v_high.message: You must downgrade to version $1 or upgrade KeePassRPC to match your version of KeeFox. Going to initiate the upgrade wizard now.

conn_client_v_low.message: You must upgrade to version $1 or downgrade KeePassRPC to match your version of KeeFox. Going to initiate the downgrade wizard now.

conn_display_description.message: A Firefox addon that securely enables automatic login to most websites.

conn_firewall_problem.message: KeeFox can not connect to KeePass. A firewall is probably blocking communication on TCP port 12546.

conn_invalid_message.message: KeeFox sent an invalid command to your password database.

conn_setup_aborted.message: Authorisation cancelled or denied. The next attempt to connect will be delayed for $1 minutes.

conn_setup_client_sl_low.message: KeeFox asked for a security level that was too low to be accepted by the password server. You must restart the authentication process using security level $1.

conn_setup_enter_password.message: Please enter the password displayed by the KeePass "Authorise a new connection" window. You do not need to remember this password. If you get it wrong you will be able to try again shortly.

conn_setup_expired.message: You have been using the same secret key for too long.

conn_setup_failed.message: KeeFox was not allowed to connect, probably because you entered the connection password incorrectly.

conn_setup_invalid_param.message: KeeFox supplied an invalid parameter. Further info may follow: $1

conn_setup_missing_param.message: KeeFox failed to supply a required parameter. Further info may follow: $1

conn_setup_restart.message: KeeFox must restart the authorisation process.

conn_setup_retype_password.message: Please type in a new password when prompted.

conn_setup_server_sl_low.message: KeeFox has rejected the connection to the password server because their security level is too low. You must restart the authentication process using security level $1.

conn_setup_client_features_missing.message: KeeFox must be upgraded to connect to your KeePass Password Safe. Ensure you are running the latest version of the browser add-on / extension.

conn_setup_server_features_missing.message: The KeePassRPC KeePass Password Safe plugin must be upgraded to allow KeeFox to connect to it. Ensure you are running the latest version of the KeePass plugin. You can start the process from the KeePass Help menu - click on "Check for Updates".

conn_sl_client_desc.message: This allows you to control how securely KeeFox will store the secret communication key inside Firefox. It is possible to configure different security settings for KeeFox and KeePass but this is rarely useful.

conn_sl_high_warning_desc.message: A high security setting will require you to enter a randomly generated password every time you start Firefox or KeePass.

conn_sl_low_warning_desc.message: A low security setting could increase the chance of your passwords being stolen. Please make sure you read the information in the manual (see link above)

conn_sl_server_min_desc.message: This allows you to prevent KeeFox from connecting to KeePass if its security level is set too low. See the options within KeePass to set the actual security level used by KeePass.

conn_sl_desc.message: Change the settings below to control how secure the communication link between Firefox and KeePass is. You probably don't need to ever adjust these settings but if you do, please make sure you have read the relevant manual pages first.

conn_sl_link.message: Learn more about these settings and the communication between Firefox and KeePass in the manual

conn_unknown_error.message: An unexpected error occured when trying to connect to your password database.

matched_logins_label.description: Header for panels/sections that contain the logins which KeeFox matched for this page/form

placeholder_for_best_match.message: Placeholder for best matching login entry

pref_Commands_intro.message: Choose the keyboard shortcuts for the main KeeFox commands.

pref_DoNothing_desc.description: Label for configuring KeeFox to take no action. Specific context may vary but will relate to auto filling and/or submitting

pref_FillAndSubmitForm_desc.message: Fill in and submit the form
pref_FillAndSubmitForm_desc.description: Fill in and submit the form

pref_FillAndSubmitPrompt_desc.message: Fill in and submit the login prompt

pref_FillingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how KeeFox behaves when filling entries into forms

pref_FillNote_desc.message: You can override the "KeeFox chooses" behaviours above for individual entries in the KeePass "edit entry" dialog.
pref_FillNote_desc.description: Tells user that the settings nearby are global/default and they are able to override on a per-entry basis via KeePass.

pref_FindingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how KeeFox behaves when finding entries for a website

pref_Logging_heading.description: The output of text information that reports on the inner-workings of KeeFox.

pref_SavingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how KeeFox behaves when saving new entries

pref_autoFillFormsWithMultipleMatches_la.message: Forms with multiple matches should be automatically filled and submitted
pref_autoFillFormsWithMultipleMatches_la.description: Forms with multiple matches should be automatically filled and submitted

pref_keePassDBToOpen_label.message: When opening or logging in to KeePass, use this database file
pref_keePassDBToOpen_label.description: When opening or logging in to KeePass, use this database file

pref_keePassRPCPort_label.message: Communicate with KeePass using this TCP/IP port
pref_keePassRPCPort_label.description: Communicate with KeePass using this TCP/IP port

pref_keePassRPCPortWarning_label.message: NB: change the setting in KeePass.config or else KeeFox will not always be able to communicate with KeePass
pref_keePassRPCPortWarning_label.description: Displayed to the user near the setting for changing the KeePassRPC port

pref_listAllOpenDBs_label.message: List logins from all open KeePass databases
pref_listAllOpenDBs_label.description: List logins from all open KeePass databases

pref_logLevel_desc.message: Choose how verbose you want the log to be. Each higher log level produces more output.
pref_logLevel_desc.description: Choose how verbose you want the log to be. Each higher log level produces more output.

pref_logLevelDebugging_label.description: Logging level for the most verbose information about KeeFox's operation

pref_logLevelInformation_label.description: Logging level for important information about KeeFox's operation

pref_logMethod_desc.message: Select where you would like KeeFox to record a log of its activity.
pref_logMethod_desc.description: Select where you would like KeeFox to record a log of its activity.

pref_notifyWhenEntryUpdated_label.description: Option to enable or diable the information displayed when a password has been updated

pref_notifyWhenLateDiscovery_label.message: Display a notification when KeeFox finds logins matching a form added after the web page has finished loading
pref_notifyWhenLateDiscovery_label.description: Display a notification when KeeFox finds logins matching a form added after the web page has finished loading

pref_rememberMRUDB_label.message: Remember the most recently used KeePass database
pref_rememberMRUDB_label.description: Remember the most recently used KeePass database

pref_rememberMRUGroup_label.message: Remember the group you most recently saved to
pref_rememberMRUGroup_label.description: Whether KeeFox will remember the name of the KeePass group most recently chosen by the user

pref_saveFavicons_label.description: Whether or not KeeFox will save the website's icon when a new entry is saved

pref_when_keefox_chooses_prompt_desc.message: When KeeFox chooses a matching login for an HTTPAuth, NTLM or proxy prompt, KeeFox should

pref_when_keefox_chooses_standard_form_d.message: When KeeFox chooses a matching login for a standard form, KeeFox should
pref_when_keefox_chooses_standard_form_d.description: Context/label for user when changing setting relating to auto-fill/submit behaviour. A list of potential actions will be displayed immediately after this string and the user can select their preferred behaviour from that list.

pref_when_user_chooses_desc.message: When you choose a matched login, KeeFox should
pref_when_user_chooses_desc.description: Context/label for user when changing setting relating to manual fill/submit behaviour. A list of potential actions will be displayed immediately after this string and the user can select their preferred behaviour from that list.

site_options_invisible_tip_desc.message: NB: The names and IDs may not be the same as visible labels on the page (they are set in the source code of the page)
site_options_invisible_tip_desc.description: Explains that the configuration settings might not be what the casual user expects

site_options_list_explain_desc.message: If a form matches against one of the white lists below KeeFox will always try to fill it. If a form matches one of the black lists below KeeFox will never try to fill it. If it matches both lists KeeFox will not try to fill it.
site_options_list_explain_desc.description: Explains how KeeFox chooses which forms to fill in

site_options_siteEnabledExplanation_desc.message: Select the checkboxes on the left to enable a setting

pref_Finding_forms_heading.description: Settings heading for how KeeFox finds forms it is (or isn't) interested in filling in with entries from KeePass

site_options_valid_form_intro_desc.message: KeeFox will try to fill matching KeePass entries for all forms that have a password field (box). You can adjust this behaviour below.
site_options_valid_form_intro_desc.description: Explains how KeeFox chooses which forms to fill in

Back_tip.message: Go back to the previous KeeFox menu

Install_Finally_description.message: Finally, if you have any trouble getting KeeFox to work correctly, please take a look at the help resources found at

Install_monoManual_description.message: KeeFox can run on Mac and Linux systems, but requires manual installation by following these steps:

Install_monoManualStep1_description.message: 1) Download and install Mono from the website below. Linux users can usually install the latest version of Mono from your distribution's package repository but please ensure you install the complete Mono package (some distributions seperate Mono into multiple sub-packages).

Install_monoManualStep2_description.message: 2) Download KeePass Password Safe 2.19 (or higher) Portable (ZIP Package) from the website below or try your distribution's package manager (make sure you get a new enough version though!)

Install_monoManualStep3_description.message: 3) Unzip KeePass to ~/KeePass (this default can be customised) where ~ represents your home directory

Install_monoManualStep4_description.message: 4) Copy the KeePassRPC.plgx file to a subdirectory called plugins in the directory that contains your KeePass installation (e.g. ~/KeePass/plugins)

Install_monoManualStep6_description.message: The KeePassRPC.plgx file you need to manually copy is at:

Install_monoManualUpgradeStep1_descripti.message: 1) Copy the KeePassRPC.plgx file to the plugins subdirectory inside the directory that contains your KeePass installation (e.g. ~/KeePass/plugins where ~ represents your home directory)

Install_setupNET35ExeInstallExpandeeManu.message: 2) Download and install KeePass Password Safe 2 setup or ZIP from http://keepass.info

Logins_Button_tip.message: Explore all your logins and quickly log in to your websites.

Matched_Logins_Button_tip.message: See the logins that matched the current page

Menu_Button_changeDB_tip.message: Choose a different KeePass password database.

Menu_Button_copyNewPasswordToClipboard_t.message: Gets a new password from KeePass using the most recently used password generator profile and puts it into your clipboard.

Menu_Button_fillCurrentDocument_tip.message: Force KeeFox to re-detect login forms on this page and search for login entries that match those forms. This is necessary on a small minority of web sites.

Menu_Button_options_tip.message: View and change your preferred KeeFox options.

Search_tip.message: Start typing to display your matching login entries

PasswordProfilesExplanation_label.message: You can optionally create a different one by selecting a password profile below. Use KeePass to save new profiles.
PasswordProfilesExplanation_label.description: You can optionally create a different one by selecting a password profile below. Use KeePass to save new profiles.

change_field_explanation.message: KeeFox will also update the website icon (favicon) and any HTTP Auth Realm information. More complex modifications will require you to manually edit the entry.

change_field_status.message: The selected entry will have all username, password and other form fields replaced with the values you have just entered.

change_url_status.message: The entry's web page address (URL) will be updated with the latest URL.

change_url_option_1.message: Replace the entry's URL (but still fill forms if you visit the old URL)

change_url_option_2.message: Replace the entry's URL (delete the old URL completely)

change_url_option_3.message: Keep the old entry's URL (but still fill forms if you visit the new URL)

change_url_option_4.message: Keep the old entry's URL (don't add the new URL to the entry)

changeDBButtonEmpty_tip.message: There are no databases in your KeePass Recent databases list. Use KeePass to open your preferred database.

disable_password_manager.message: The KeeFox add-on may not work correctly if you allow Firefox to manage your passwords. Should KeeFox disable the built-in Firefox password manager?

dismiss_notification.message: Dismiss this notification without taking any action

generatePassword_copied.message: A new password has been copied to your clipboard.
generatePassword_copied.description: A new password has been copied to your clipboard.

httpAuth_default.message: You are logged out of your password database (it may be locked)

keepass_history_pointer.message: KeePass has an "undo" feature which you can access from the KeePass "edit entry" dialog window. Click on the "History" tab and then use the "Restore" button to revert to an older version.

launchKeePass_tip.message: You need to open and log into KeePass to use KeeFox. Click here to do that.

loggedIn_tip.message: You are logged in to your '$1' password database

loggedInMultiple_tip.message: You are logged in to $1 password databases. '$2' is active.

loggedOut_tip.message: You are logged out of your password database (it may be locked)

loginsButtonEmpty_tip.message: This folder has no logins inside it

loginsButtonGroup_tip.message: Explore the logins inside this folder.

loginsButtonLogin_tip.message: Login to $1 with this username: $2. Right click for more options.

multi_page_update_warning.message: Multi-page login forms may also require manual editing.

notifyBarLaunchKeePass_label.message: You are not logged in to your password database.

notifyBarLogSensitiveData_label.message: WARNING: KeeFox is logging your passwords! If you have not intentionally enabled this setting you should disable it immediately

notifyBarLoginToKeePassButton_tip.message: Login to your KeePass database to enable KeeFox

saveMultiPagePasswordText.message: Do you want KeeFox to save this multi-page password?

savePasswordText.message: Do you want KeeFox to save this password?

view_them_in_the_main_keefox_panel.message: View them in the main KeeFox panel

close.description: Action user can click on to close/dismiss a panel or other user interface element

autoclose_countdown.description: Label for a user interface element which allows the user to disable the auto-close functionality. Also tells the user how many seconds are remaining before the auto-close functionality triggers.
